bibl.title: Hazzard v. Aguirre and Price. Memo from the Sheriff
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Pierce} ss

I JH Price sheriff of Pierce County do hereby certify that the within writ came into my hands on the 6th day of October 1889 and on the 8th day of October 1889 I duly served the same by bringing the body of the said George Hazzard into Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Tacoma in and for Pierce County Washington Territory, and Mr James H Price and MG Aguirre, do hereby certify and return as follows, that the cause of the said imprisonment and detention of the said George Hazzard by no under and by the authority of a warrant of Extradition issued by Miles C Moore Governor of Washington Territory on the 5th day of October 1889 Directed M.G. Aguirre the duly authorized agent of the State of California Authorizing and empowering the said M.G. Aguirre to take the said George Hazzard whenever he be found in Washington Territory and to transfer him to the line of thereof and commanding all evil offense within the said Territory of Washington to afford all nulfull assistance for the execution of the said warrant and which said warrant recides That the said George Hazzard is charged with the Crime of Grand Larceny commented in the County of Los Angeles in said state of California, and that the said George Hazzard is confined and in my custody to be taken to the State of California upon said warrant and in pursued
